meanings.def: to make something, especially somebody’s confidence or authority, gradually weaker or less effective
examples: Our confidence in the team has been seriously undermined by their recent defeats.
This crisis has undermined his position.
Recent changes have undermined teachers’ morale.
The director saw this move as an attempt to undermine his authority.
It's all a plot to undermine me.

meanings.def: to make something weaker at the base, for example by digging under it
